text: Thomas Hodgkin (17 August 1798 â€“ 5 April 1866) was an English physician. He was born in Pentonville, Middlesex. He researched many kinds of diseases and discovered Hodgkin's disease. He died of dysentery in Jaffa, Ottoman Syria. Category:1798 births Category:1866 deaths Category:English physicians Category:People from Middlesex Category:Deaths from dysentery
title: Thomas Hodgkin
